activities.originalActivity: After any setback, ask 'What can I learn from this?' and 'How can I use this to get stronger?'

dailyDoItems.action: I write down exactly what happened in this setback using only factual details, no interpretations
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have written a factual account without emotional language

dailyDoItems.action: I engage in an AI-guided discussion to identify 3 specific lessons from this experience
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have identified 3 concrete lessons I can apply going forward

aiDiscussion.inviteMessage: Would it be helpful if I guide you through discovering what this setback can teach you?

dailyDoItems.action: I choose one specific way to apply these lessons immediately and take that action today
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have taken one concrete action based on what I learned

activities.originalActivity: Always ask 'How can I make this work better AND look more beautiful?'

dailyDoItems.action: I pick one thing I'm currently working on and examine both its function and appearance
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have identified specific aspects of function and appearance to improve

dailyDoItems.action: I engage in an AI-guided brainstorming session to find ways to improve both function and beauty
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have generated 3 ideas that improve both how it works and how it looks

aiDiscussion.inviteMessage: Ready to brainstorm ways to make this both more functional and more beautiful?

dailyDoItems.action: I implement the most promising improvement that enhances both function and beauty
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have made one change that improves both how it works and how it looks

activities.originalActivity: Ask 'Can I actually control this?' and only spend energy on things where the answer is yes

dailyDoItems.action: I write down one current worry or frustration that's consuming my mental energy
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have written down one specific worry or frustration

dailyDoItems.action: I create two columns labeled 'I Can Control' and 'I Cannot Control' and sort aspects of this situation
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have sorted at least 5 aspects into the appropriate control columns

dailyDoItems.action: I take one specific action on something from my 'I Can Control' list and mentally release the rest
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have completed one action on something I can control and consciously let go of what I can't

activities.originalActivity: Ask 'How can I show love to this person?' even when they're difficult or unkind

dailyDoItems.action: I pause and take three deep breaths when I notice frustration or anger toward someone
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have completed 3 full breaths before responding

dailyDoItems.action: I engage in an AI-guided reflection to find one way to show genuine care for this person
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have identified one specific, genuine way to show love despite their behavior

aiDiscussion.inviteMessage: Would you like help exploring ways to show love to someone who's being difficult?

dailyDoItems.action: I express this loving action toward them, focusing on their wellbeing rather than my feelings
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have taken one loving action toward this person despite their difficult behavior

activities.originalActivity: List 10 priorities, then cross out 7. Only work on the remaining 3.

dailyDoItems.action: I write down exactly 10 current tasks or projects on paper, numbering them 1-10
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have a numbered list of exactly 10 items written down

dailyDoItems.action: I physically cross out items 4-10 with a red pen while saying 'This is not my focus right now'
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: 7 items are crossed out and I can clearly state my top 3 priorities

dailyDoItems.action: I commit to working only on my top 3 items today and decline any requests that don't support them
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have said no to at least one thing that wasn't in my top 3

activities.originalActivity: Listen to understand the person's heart, not just to respond to their words

dailyDoItems.action: I put away my phone and face the person speaking, making soft eye contact
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: My phone is away and I'm physically oriented toward the speaker

dailyDoItems.action: I listen for what emotion or need is behind their words and silently name it to myself
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have identified at least one emotion or need driving what they're saying

dailyDoItems.action: I reflect back what I heard using 'It sounds like you're feeling...' or 'What I'm hearing is...'
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have reflected their emotional experience back to them in my own words

activities.originalActivity: Take three conscious breaths before starting any new activity

dailyDoItems.action: I notice when I'm about to start a new task and pause before beginning
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have caught myself transitioning to a new activity and paused

dailyDoItems.action: I take exactly three slow, conscious breaths, feeling each inhale and exhale completely
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have completed 3 full, conscious breaths with attention on the breathing

dailyDoItems.action: I set a clear intention for this new activity before beginning it
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have mentally stated what I want to accomplish in this activity

activities.originalActivity: Write down 3 things you're grateful for and 1 thing you learned each evening

dailyDoItems.action: I sit quietly and recall 3 specific moments from today that I genuinely appreciate
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have identified 3 specific moments I'm grateful for, not general things

dailyDoItems.action: I write down these 3 gratitudes with details about why each one mattered to me
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have written 3 gratitudes with specific reasons why they're meaningful

dailyDoItems.action: I engage in an AI-guided reflection to identify one significant thing I learned today
dailyDoItems.successCriteria: I have identified and written one specific learning from today

aiDiscussion.inviteMessage: Want to explore what you learned today? Sometimes the best insights aren't obvious at first.
